quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Hurricane Katrina and Microbes
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, bush, creatures. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Former first lady Barbara Bush made the following remark about the New Orleans refugees, housed in the Houston Astrodome: And so many of the people in the arena here, you know, were underprivileged anyway, so this, this is working very well for them.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In 2004, a National Geographic article foretold the formation of the flood that devastated New Orleans after Hurricane Katrina.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Bacillus Thuringiensis, which is usually found naturally in the soil, is used as this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Insecticide

questions.question: In the 2005 hurricane season, there were 13 hurricanes of the overall number of 27 registered storms, which broke the record of 12, set in 1969.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Lactic acid bacteria help achieve this.

options.text: Prevent milk from turning into yogurt

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Keep vegetables fresher

questions.question: This is why Mycobacterium Tuberculosis, the bacteria which causes tuberculosis is called the literary microbe.

options.text: There is a lot to read about it
It is discussed in many scientific books
It is mentioned in many literary works

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Many writers caught tuberculosis

questions.question: The disastrous 2005 Atlantic hurricane season broke the 1933 record of 21 named storms.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Microbes are generally considered to be this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Both harmless and deadly.

questions.question: Pat Robertson, the host of the 700 Club TV program, stated that Hurricane Katrina was caused by Gods anger over the selection of lesbian comedienne Ellen Degeneres to host the upcoming Emmy Awards.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The White House rejected Louisiana governor Kathleen Blancos request to declare an emergency before Hurricane Katrina had struck.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: It has been revealed that some debit cards issued to Hurricane Katrina evacuees were used for purchasing luxury or entertainment items.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: After Hurricane Katrina, evacuees from Louisiana, Mississippi, and Alabama were granted two months of food stamps and free gasoline from the Texas Department of Health and Human Services.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: There are billions of these microscopic creatures in your bed and they feed on this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dead skin cells

questions.question: There is proof that microbes existed on this planet.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mars

questions.question: After Hurricane Katrina’s strike, reverend Jesse Lee Peterson, a nationally syndicated African American host of a radio talk show, criticized New Orleans African Americans for both blaming the federal government and expecting handouts from it.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Doctor and Nurse
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, chaperon, abc. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In medical practice, what is the purpose of a chaperon?

options.text: To distract the patient when the doctor is performing a painful procedure
To keep male and female patients apart
To keep male and female employees from behaving inappropriately in the office
To protect doctors against lawsuits by patients for inappropriate sexual advances

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To protect doctors against lawsuits by patients for inappropriate sexual advances

questions.question: What is called a capitated plan in the medical fields?

options.text: A treatment plan which relates to the patients head.
An insurance plan, which pays the doctor a certain amount per month
An insurance plan, which only covers up to a certain amount per visit
A treatment plan which has a definite endpoint.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An insurance plan, which pays the doctor a certain amount per month

questions.question: This is considered the first  American sitcom with a gay character.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Corner Bar

questions.question: Which sitcom aired on ABC from 1952 to 1966 after a ten-year run on radio?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ozzie and Harriet

questions.question: Which of the following comedies has been on TV the most number of years?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Simpsons

questions.question: If the nurse writes NKDA on your chart, what does it mean?

options.text: Your vital signs are WNL (within normal limits).
You told the nurse you are not allergic to any medications.
You did not pay your bill.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: You told the nurse you are not allergic to any medications.

questions.question: If the nurse approaches the doctor and says, Doctor, theres a code in the lobby, what is the doctor likely to do?

options.text: Say thank you and resume what he was doing
Go home because the office is closed for the day

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tell the nurse to call 911

questions.question: Why do two patients sometimes have appointments with the same doctor at the same time?

options.text: Because the doctors time is more valuable than the patients time
Usually due to a scheduling error

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Because of no-shows

questions.question: In medical jargon, what is a Well Woman Exam?

options.text: A full physical examination on a female adult who has no medical problems
An exam on the doctor by a female who is well
An exam on a female which finds herself to be well

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A routine gynaecologic exam

questions.question: What does the term a positive review of systems refer to?

options.text: To every symptom question, the patient says yes
The patient reviews his symptoms well
To every symptom question, the patient says no

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To every symptom question, the patient says yes

questions.question: Which of the following abbreviations pertains to a diagnosis?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ICD-9 Code

questions.question: What is a difficult patient in medical jargon?

options.text: A patient who upsets the doctor or the office staff in some way
A patient who has a disease which is difficult to treat

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A patient who upsets the doctor or the office staff in some way

questions.question: In 2005, Katrina became the strongest hurricane on record in the Atlantic Basin with a pressure of 882 millibars breaking the old record set by Gilbert (888 mb) in 1988.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In what year was the word bastard first used on TV?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1974

questions.question: Choose the correct ordering of these medical jobs abbreviations, in increasing order of salary.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: MA, LPN, RN, PA, MD

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Following and Country
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, dealt, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following was the first womens advocacy show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leave It To The Girls

questions.question: In which country was the term television coined?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: France

questions.question: Which show was the first to have an episode which dealt with abortion?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maude

questions.question: Which game show was hit by a scandal in 1958?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Twenty-One

questions.question: Which of these television networks came first?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: NBC

questions.question: What year marked the first broadcast of a baseball game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1939

questions.question: Which company paid for the first TV ad?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bulova (watches)

questions.question: For which of the following tubes is the blood to additive ratio most critical?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Light Blue stopper

questions.question: The first scheduled TV  broadcasts, which began in 1928, originated in which US state?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Jersey

questions.question: What was the occupation of TV personality Harry Volkman?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: TV weatherman

questions.question: Containers used for disposing of needles and other sharp objects must be all of the following except which one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Recyclable

questions.question: This popular police show, which ran from 1951 to 1959, is famous for its very quick paced and to the point dialogue. It starred Jack Webb as police detective Joe Friday, badge#714.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dragnet

questions.question: Which type of patient is most likely to have an AV fistula or graft?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dialysis

questions.question: Which was the first soap opera broadcast on an American television network?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Faraway Hill

questions.question: Who was the first US President to address the nation on TV?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Truman

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Architecture and Vein
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, puncture, drawn. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In some animals life cycle there are several stages of development involving abrupt bodily changes. What is this biological process called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Metamorphosis

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT needed for skin puncture?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: povidone-iodine pad

questions.question: What vein is usually the first choice when selecting a site for venipuncture?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Median Cubital

questions.question: Which part of a cell contains the chromosomes or genetic material?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nucleus

questions.question: This annually awarded architecture prize is usually referred to as ‘The Nobel Prize for Architecture’.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pritzker Architecture Prize

questions.question: What do you call the transfer of pollen grains from the anther to the stigma of flowers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pollination

questions.question: How many bones is an adults human skeletal system made up of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 206

questions.question: In what type of tube is blood drawn for a substance abuse test?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red

questions.question: The Antecubital Fossa is the major vein in the arm for intended vein puncture.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What marrow produces blood cells in the human body?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red marrow

questions.question: When performing a routine blood draw, the basilic vein is the best choice.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The Baroque period of architecture is characterized by vivid colours, luxurious materials and elaborate surface textures. Which of these buildings is an example of typical Baroque architecture?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: St Peter’s Basilica

questions.question: When a client complained that the roof in his building leaks, this famous architect who had designed the building replied: ‘That’s how you can tell it’s a roof’.  Another work of his was the Guggenheim Museum in New York.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frank Lloyd Wright

questions.question: What do you call the force which slows down and stops a moving object?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Friction

questions.question: What is the smallest basic particle of matter?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Atom

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Movie and Mathematician
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, hoffman, examples. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In The Wizard of Oz movie, Scarecrow states which very important mathematical theorem?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Law of Pythagoras

questions.question: What 1997 movie featured Cartesian co-ordinates (the usual type of graph paper) and factoring numbers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cube

questions.question: In which movie does Edward James Olmos play a teacher in Los Angeles who gets an entire class of low-income, Hispanic students to pass the Advanced Placement Calculus test?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stand and Deliver

questions.question: In this fine movie Dustin Hoffman plays a mathematician who gets tired of being picked on.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Straw Dogs

questions.question: The groundbreaking design of this building was created by Danish architect, Jorn Utzon. It is located by the sea, and its roof resembles white sails.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sydney Opera House

questions.question: This architectural term, which refers to a free-standing bell-tower, comes from Italian and means a high bell tower.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Campanile

questions.question: This Spanish architect designed La Sagrada Familia, one of the most famous buildings in Barcelona.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Antonio Gaudi

questions.question: Which of these is a movie about a mathematician who develops a formula that predicts the prices of stock markets?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Bank

questions.question: The construction of this famous building was completed on November 1st, 1800. It was designed by Irish-born architect James Hoban, who was inspired by the Leinster House in Dublin.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The White House

questions.question: Proof was originally a play about a brilliant mathematician who worries about inheriting her fathers insanity. Which actress was the star of the 2005 movie of the same name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gwyneth Platrow

questions.question: This architecture style is characterized by the use of materials such as stainless steel and aluminium. It aimed at nontraditional elegance that symbolizes wealth and sophistication.  It originated in Europe in 1920s and formed its name in 1925 at the World’s Fair, held in Paris.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Art Deco

questions.question: In this movie Ayla, played by Daryl Hannah, teaches her new family to count all the way to ten.

options.text: The Clan of the Cave Bear

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Clan of the Cave Bear

questions.question: In which movie does Bud Abbott “prove to Lou Costello that 13 x 7 = 28?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In the Navy

questions.question: There are seven tall buildings in Moscow, regarded as typical examples of Stalinist Architecture. What are these similarly designed buildings referred to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ‘Stalin’s Seven Sisters’

questions.question: Sharply pointed spires, stained glass and pointed arches are typical for this architecture style. It is mainly associated with cathedrals and other religious buildings.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gothic

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Lightning and Job
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, deaths, mean. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: A flash of lightning can heat the air around it, which gives off vibrations and expansion of the air thus causing what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thunder

questions.question: Which statement concerning whales is true?

options.text: All whales have two blow holes.
Some whales have one blow hole and some have two.
Every whale has exactly one blow hole.
Only some whales have blow holes.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Some whales have one blow hole and some have two.

questions.question: What did early Greeks believe lightning was?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The weapon of Zeus

questions.question: Lightning is caused by the increased imbalance of positive and negative charges during storms.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: A lightning bolt can produce what voltage?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1 billion volts

questions.question: Which of these statements is true?

options.text: Humans are the only mammals that cry.
Humans and elephants are the only mammals that cry.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Humans and elephants are the only mammals that cry.

questions.question: In the movie “Little Big League, the hero must solve this problem: John can finish a job in five hours. Mary can finish the same job in three hours. If they work together, how long will it take to finish the job? What is the answer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1 and 7/8 hours

questions.question: What does the term bolts from the blue mean?

options.text: Horizontal lightning that seems to come from no where
Lighting strikes on a clear day

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Horizontal lightning that seems to come from no where

questions.question: Quickly calculate 95^2 (i.e. 95X95). What is the result?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 9025

questions.question: In this film, high school student Max Fisher, played by Jason Schwartzman, is asked to use calculus to find the area of an ellipse.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rushmore

questions.question: According to the U.S. National Weather Service, after you see and hear the last flash of lightning and roar of thunder, you should wait how long before presuming outdoor activities?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 30 minutes

questions.question: Which of Santa Klaus reindeers’ name means lightning?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blitzen

questions.question: What molecule has the formula O3?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ozone

questions.question: Between 1997 and 2006, there were how many reported deaths from lightning?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 437

questions.question: What is the meaning of plasmodium?

options.text: The part of the blood that covers red and white blood cells and platelets
The liquid-like substance found in animal and plant cells
The gel-like substance that holds fish eggs together

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The parasite that causes malaria
